alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 05 at 5:08AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A Threat of Widespread Flooding has Diminished... A warm front returning from the south and passing upper level support will bring widespread showers, and a few thunderstorms to the Tennessee Valley into the middle of the week. Rainfall totals will range from 1 to 3 inches, with locally higher amounts. The heaviest rainfall is expected to occur from this afternoon to early Tuesday morning, with locally amounts greater than 2 inches possible. The returning front should move north of the area Tuesday and Wednesday. This further northward location will help reduce overall rainfall totals, which has lowered an overall risk of flooding. That said, locations that receive repeat episodes of heavy rainfall could experience areal or flash flooding. Also, river levels across the area could rise to action stage or higher in the mid and latter portions of the week. Residents in the Tennessee Valley should stay current with the latest forecast updates from the National Weather Service. For additional hydrologic information, visit our website at: weather.gov/huntsville
